title: 114_hr1398
content: The "American Innovation Act" may be cited as the short title of this legislation. The Act includes a cap adjustment provision. The "American Innovation Act" includes a cap adjustment provision for basic science research funding, specifically for the National Science Foundation. Adjustments for fiscal years are based on the additional new budget authority provided in the appropriations bill. The "American Innovation Act" includes cap adjustments for basic science research funding for the National Science Foundation, with increasing additional new budget authority allocated for fiscal years 2016 to 2020. The "American Innovation Act" includes cap adjustments for basic science research funding for the National Science Foundation, with increasing additional new budget authority allocated for fiscal years 2016 to 2020. For fiscal year 2021, $2,867,000,000 in additional new budget authority is specified. If a bill specifies amounts for the Department of Energy Office of Science, adjustments shall be made based on the additional new budget authority provided in that Act, not exceeding $275,000,000 for fiscal year 2016. The "American Innovation Act" includes increasing additional new budget authority for basic science research funding for the National Science Foundation from fiscal years 2016 to 2021, with amounts specified as follows: $275,000,000 for 2016, $566,000,000 for 2017, $867,000,000 for 2018, $1,198,000,000 for 2019, $1,555,000,000 for 2020, and $1,946,000,000 for 2021. The additional new budget authority for Department of Defense science and technology programs is $636,000,000 for fiscal year 2016. For fiscal years 2017 to 2021, there is an increasing amount of additional new budget authority allocated as follows: $1,309,000,000, $2,007,000,000, $2,773,000,000, $3,603,000,000, and $4,512,000,000 respectively. For fiscal years 2017 to 2021, there is an increasing amount of additional new budget authority allocated for Scientific and Technical Research and Services within the National Institute of Standards and Technology. For fiscal years 2016 to 2021, there is a progressive increase in additional new budget authority allocated for Scientific and Technical Research and Services within the National Institute of Standards and Technology, starting from $31,000,000 in 2016 to $173,000,000 in 2020. For fiscal year 2021, $216,000,000 in additional new budget authority is allocated for the National Aeronautics and Space Administration Science Directorate. Adjustments for that fiscal year shall be based on the amount specified in the enacted appropriations bill for the Science Mission Directorate, not exceeding the allocated amount for fiscal year 2016. For fiscal years 2016 to 2021, additional new budget authority allocations are as follows: $267 million, $559 million, $876 million, $1.222 billion, $1.598 billion, and $216 million respectively. For fiscal year 2021, an additional $2,006,000,000 in new budget authority was allocated. The term 'additional new budget authority' refers to the amount provided for a fiscal year that exceeds the amount provided in fiscal year 2015 in an appropriation Act. For fiscal year 2021, additional funding was allocated for the National Science Foundation, Department of Energy Office of Science, and Department of Defense Science and Technology Programs. For fiscal year 2021, extra funding was designated for the National Science Foundation, Department of Energy Office of Science, and Department of Defense Science and Technology Programs. Additionally, excess amounts specified for the National Institute of Standards and Technology Scientific and Technical Research Services were included. Extra amounts were also specified for the National Institute of Standards and Technology Scientific and Technical Research Services to support the National Aeronautics and Space Administration Science Directorate. The Department of Energy Office of Science and Department of Defense Science and Technology programs are appropriations accounts supporting various institutes, offices, and centers within their respective departments. The curr_chunk discusses the National Aeronautics and Space Administration Science Directorate and authorizes appropriations for the National Science Foundation in fiscal years 2016 through 2021. The curr_chunk discusses appropriations for various science and technology programs in fiscal years 2016 through 2021, including the Department of Energy Office of Sciences, Department of Defense Science and Technology programs, and the National Institute of Standards and Technology Scientific and Technical Research and Services. The curr_chunk discusses appropriations for the National Aeronautics and Space Administration Science Directorate in fiscal years 2016 through 2021, with minimum funding requirements specified for subsequent years. Certain appropriations are exempt from sequestration according to section 255(g)(1)(A) of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985. The curr_chunk amends the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act to include appropriations under the American Innovation Act. This amendment applies to any sequestration order issued after the enactment of the Act.
